availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
United States of America,
State of New York,
City and County of New York, } SS:

I, William Johnston Sinclair, of the City of New York, Counsellor at Law, having been duly appointed by His Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky a Commissioner of Deeds, within the State of New York, for the said Commonwealth of Kentucky, do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute and perform all the duties of the said office --

figure.ab:
WM. J. SINCLAIR
COMMISSIONER
NEW YORK

body.p: Subscribed and Sworn to before me, this sixth day of February, A.D. 1862,

figure.ab:
CHARLES S. PRINCE
NOTARY
PUBLIC,
NEW YORK.

body.p: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of my new Commission for Kentucky, and to send, above, the oath of office --

New York
Comr. of Deeds
Oath
Wm J. Sinclair
Filed Feby 10th 1862
